# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) <= text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= word * " "
    end
    push!(lines, line) # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
print(wrap_string(text, 10))
```
This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit. Sed do
eiusmod tempor
incididunt ut
labore et dolore
magna aliqua.
```
